website_summaries.verdict: Works flawlessly in 10- to 40-gallon aquariums, and adjustable temperature is a huge plus.
pros: Thermoplastic material means no shattered glass
Green and red indicator LEDs are helpful
Adjustable temperature gives users greater control over tank temps
Reliable, operating for years without a problem
cons: Some owners report that unit doesn’t heat accurately
Reports of parts corroding or rusting, mainly in hard-water environments

customer_reviews.title: So I bought this on October 5th of this year ...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this on October 5th of this year b/c my other glass aqueon heaters were making that knocking noise. I've been using this heater in a barebottom 10g tank that has cory fry which are about 3 months old. Woke up this morning and saw some dead along with condensation all around the glass. I quickly check the temperature of the water and it's freezing cold, meaning that the heater was busted. One month...and it's busted. Can't return it, lost some fry, and I will never be buying aqueon heaters again. The glass heaters failed me once, and this "pro" version failed even faster.
customer_reviews.author: Thai Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Best heater I have had
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how much better this heater is than any other heater I have had, including my most recent (Marineland ML90650 Precision Heater for Aquarium, 100-watt). With the Marineland I was having to constantly adjust it because of minor changes in room temperature, whereas this heater I have set and pretty much is within +/-0.3 degrees F based on three temperature probes in my tank including a "La Crosse Technology 926-25106-Wgb Wireless Monitor System Set with Wet Probe" which logs readings every 15 mins. Might not be needed for those that don't care that their temperature changes a few degrees, but for me/someone who wants the range tighter this is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have heeded the advice from the reviews. Now I'm having to go through the process of sending this pro 50 heater back that didn't heat and the top came off. I didn't even order the clear top. I ordered the blue top. They want you to jump through hoops to send it back when they send it in a poly-mailer which caused the box to be crushed. I have three other heaters like this, they are great. They we're not ordered from Amazon. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marylin

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat seems broken
customer_reviews.text: Update: The temperature keeps climbing. It's up 10 degrees now. I don't know whether to try to exchange it or try fir a refund. I purchased this based on the positive reviews. My tank temperature has gone up 5 degrees within a 30 hour period. I have to assume the thermostat is broken. I'm very disappointed in this submersible tank heater.
customer_reviews.author: critique

customer_reviews.title: Used to work, doesn't work anymore
customer_reviews.text: Bought in August. I got the 100W for my 29g and it worked fine until today. It's not keeping the tank any higher than 70, even though it's set to 74. I turned it up to 78 just now in the hopes that that'll have some effect. Extremely disappointed in this product, especially since I just bought a smaller one today for a different tank.
customer_reviews.author: Rook

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the 50W in a 10 gal, 5, and 6 gallon tanks, each purchased 2-3 years ago. I haven't had any issues with any of them so far. The only issue is that the temp on the heater isn't always what my thermometer is , however whatever temp I do have it on, it is very stable. So I rely on my thermometer to set the temp instead of the number markings on the heater. I first got this model because it fit perfectly inside the filter compartment of the Fluval Spec 5. I liked the stability so much , I ended up getting one for my other tanks.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Best heater in the game
customer_reviews.text: This is an AMAZING product. I have owned it for roughly 2 years and it works as well as it did day 1. I have this plugged into my turtle's tank to provide heat and keep the water at a well regulated temperature. The heater runs 24 hours a day 7 days a week, excluding when I have it off for water changes and tank cleanings (basically every other week for like an hour). It works like a charm after all this time and I cannot say enough wonderful things about it. The heater is NOT hot to the touch even when it is set at 82 F.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bartolomei

customer_reviews.title: Cooked my Dwarf Puffer today after 3.5 yrs of fine operation
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 3.5 years. Then today, 104 degrees and a cooked puffer! It split open, and was glowing red-hot and steaming when I removed it. This was the 200 watt model. My 50 watt model is working OK in another tank, but I'm going to replace it... Are there any safe heaters out there? Is 3.5 yrs too long to expect a heater to work? Any suggestions would be appreciated...
customer_reviews.author: John S. Fiorino

customer_reviews.title: Love this heater!
customer_reviews.text: I love this heater. I have 3 of them now, 2 in 10 gallon tanks and 1 in a 40 gallon tank. The only problem I've ever run into was that the one in the 40 gallon was making a strange knocking sound when it was completely horizontal. It's now at the tiniest angle and the noise has stopped. Maybe up against something when it was horizontal. I recommend this heater to everyone. I've used the glass Aqueon heaters and have had problems with them in the past, but this non-glass one is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: My choice for heaters
customer_reviews.text: The aqueon pro heater haves been my favorite for years on my six tanks. The ones I have are made in italy. I was disappointed to find out the new pros are made in China. Aqueon please keep the older ones that are made in Italy as those are great heaters and great customer service that I have known for years.
customer_reviews.author: love walk

customer_reviews.title: Observe which model you receive
customer_reviews.text: Customers should know that they are getting the new model 100532084 , asin B07JG9XKWK NOT the model listed on this page 100106106 - B003C5TPF6 when ordering from Petco. The older, better model is not longer being produced.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice heater
customer_reviews.text: I have this mounted horizontal near the bottom of my tank. It's visually unobtrusive and keeps temp perfectly. The cord is a good length so I was able to place it where I wanted without issue. Suction cups are very strong, no worries that it will pop off. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Artist

customer_reviews.title: Failed killed life in aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Heater failed when I was on vacation, killed several members of my salt water aquarium, bleached my corals as well due to substantial drop in the temperature. Decided to bite the bullet and purchase not expensive cobalt 100w heater.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted 3 years., but worked well when it was working.
customer_reviews.text: I'm of 2 minds about this product. While it worked it was spot on and trouble free. But, I'm disappointed that it only lasted barely 3 years before it stopped working suddenly and without warning. The Green light was/is still on (indicating it is at temperature), but my aquarium temp has dropped 6 degrees in 3 days, and turning it up does nothing. Thankfully, this didn't happen while I was away on a 2 1/2 week vacation recently. It's disappointing because this unit replaced one of those old, basic, cheap-o heaters that worked perfectly for about 15 years. Trying something different this time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as long as you keep one thing in mind.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for over a year and it is working fine with no issues. If you are living in warm places like California or Florida, a strong piece of advise is to set it to -4 degrees than the actual temperature that you want. I advise this due to the fact that some people complained about the appliance over heating the water. This is most likely true. I have set the temperature on my appliance to 72 degree F, and almost at all time the water temperature showed 76 degree F. As long as you keep that in mind, there is no worries needed to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lijo Lukose

customer_reviews.title: Good build, not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: It's of good build quality and love that it won't crack like the glass ones but I have this on a 10 gallon tank as recommended and it's been set to 80 degrees for like 2 months and my thermometer never reads over 78 so that is my one issue. And I've even turned it up higher btw!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Works most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing, but every once in a while it gives me a green light as it detects a temperature drop. Cost me shrimp when my tank dropped 6 degrees suddenly. Have the 200 watt one as well, which has a problem with the LED (Purchased a returned one I guess) but heats like a champ. As with all things pet keeping and in particular aquatic, keep a careful eye on them, and consider doubling your heaters so they are failsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1 month. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Failed in about one month. The green light keeps on although the temperature is way below the set value. Lost the original package and cannot return it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: seabiscuit

customer_reviews.title: IT FAILED AND ALMOST KILLED MY FISH
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this product up until recently. I bought 2, one is working fine but I'm now hesitant to use it any longer. It worked for about 2 days then stopped working. I woke up expecting to see my imported betta whizzing around begging for food but he just sat at the bottom of the tank, lifeless. Checked the temp. and it was at 60 degrees! Fortunately, I had a spare WORKABLE heater to use and that it's getting warmer where I live. This could've killed my very EXPENSIVE imported fish! I don't recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Theromoplastic FTW
customer_reviews.text: The temperature control on this seems WAY off. I have to set it at around 72 to maintain an 80 degree temp. Lame, but now that I know that quirk, I'm ok with it because I love the fact that this is a thermoplastic device, not glass. I don't have to worry about a random crack & electrocuting everything. I can do water changes & not worry about exposing any part of the heater. I've had several glass heaters in the past and I hate how delicate they can be.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this, never worked as it should have.
customer_reviews.text: So this thing didn't even last me a year in my little 5 gallon tank. It never did work as advertised. I've had to crank it all the way up just to get my water to 78 degrees. I have a separate thermometer that is working fine. Now it only heats up to 76 on the highest setting, very disappointed. I was careful with this, always unplugged it when doing any maintenance in my tank. I guess it's a good thing my fish died recently. RIP HARRY POTTER.
customer_reviews.author: Shannen S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heater! I like how long it is because it provides a large surface area for the water to flow around and heat up. The temperature control is easy to use without having to pull out of the water. Despite its size I would say its fairly low profile. It's placed on the back wall of my tank and I hardly notice it unless I'm doing aquarium maintenance. Definitely worth the price and I have already ordered a second for my other tank.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona L.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted ONLY 1 year, DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I lost faith in the brand when my 45-gallon tank(not even 2 years old) leaked and almost killed all my fish....that was a few years back, I gave Aqueon another chance, big mistake which I will NOT make again. Bought this Aqueon Pro Submersible 50W Heater a little bit over a year ago and luckily, I was home when I noticed lights flashing green and red every second on it. Turns out the heater is "dead in the water". Temperature was only 64F in the tank(Tropical Fish), none of the fish died but if I were away this could have ended a different way.
customer_reviews.author: JLO

customer_reviews.title: Reliable heater
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heater for my 28 gallon tank. Keeps the temp of the water stable through the winter within 1/2 degree although the temp on the heater itself does not necessarily match the set temp. I recommend using a digital thermometer to figure out the temp rather than relying on the temperature knob which might be way off. I also like that it has a green light to tell you it has reached the correct temp and red when it is heating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around
customer_reviews.text: The heater has been holding up quite well in my 29 gallon tank throughout the north-east Winter. The dial is a bit vague (you can barely make out the numbers) and a chore to set but once it is set at the correct temperature it performs flawlessly and never fluctuates. I do like the resin plastic body as it doesn't harm the fish. Well done overall.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne G

customer_reviews.title: STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would feel kind of cheap but this thing is SOLID and feels super heavy duty. Now im feeling great about my heater. The reading is pinpoint accurate on the temperature. You can submerge all the way, but i have the top bit sticking out. This is kind of a very long heater for a 20L (vertically). Give it a few minutes to acclimate to the water when you first put it in before second guessing it
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyOregon

customer_reviews.title: Heater died and killed my fish.
customer_reviews.text: I woke up one morning to find all my fish were dead and the water freezing cold. Very sad day. Purchased last august.
customer_reviews.author: metzmedia

customer_reviews.title: Maintains a steady temperature
customer_reviews.text: Only reason i am giving 4 stars instead of 5, the heater dial is not calibrated accurately. The reading in my thermometer (which i verified is accurate) and the reading in the heater dial doesn't match. I had to set for a higher temperature reading in the heater to get the desired temperature. However, the temperature never fluctuates and the heater maintains the temperature all the time. And it is one of the best looking heater i have had.
customer_reviews.author: Arunkumar M S

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, dependable
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality, love the green ready light and red heating light, very sturdy, bought the 250w for my 75g also, had the basic series 300w that began knocking, wanted to stay superb customer service from Aqueon, send them pics of faulty standard 300w and they shipped me a new one no questions asked, saving it for a back up or another tank, I dont't think the pro series will fail anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Change Your Oil

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: These heaters are very accurate, easy to use, hard to break, and are a good value. Some of the wattages are very long. After 30 years in the hobby I find these to be the most dependable and accurate, and best value. You could spend more if you want to go digital, but these do the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Allright

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 of these for your 55 gallon tank!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100 watt from walmart in my 55 gallon with my angel fish and guppies. It shorted out and would not shut off. The temp went up to 93 degrees which killed most of my guppies. Luckily my angels survived... I saw online where it happened all the time and people had lost 1000's of dollars in fish from junky heaters... I ordered (2) of these to run my 55 gallon and I can already tell you the quality far exceeds the quality of my last junk heater. This unit is solid and the LED and housing is thick and well made. It doesnt run as much maintaining temp at 78 degrees. 5 stars. buy it.
customer_reviews.author: IslandLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used aqueon pro heaters in all my aquariums for years with great results. However, the one I received was the redesign (light up knob instead of a light on the side) which is not shown in any of the pictures for this listing. It looks good but the knob is flimsy and fell off in my aquarium. I have no idea if it is safe or how to set the proper temperature now. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great once set, lasted 18 months and burned out.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to set temperature, control is very hard to finesse to the right temp. Temp will vary +/- 3 degrees in stable room temp. Burned out after 18 months, filled the room with burning plastic smell, and yes it was fully submerged. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Avatar

customer_reviews.title: works well so far not bad ill keep it .
customer_reviews.text: it was ok tak awhile 2 heat my 20gallon glass thermometer is there 2 mak sure its on point,,,i hav 2 higher it more lik at 84 degrees on the heater 2 get it at 80 degrees the numbers r blk kinda hard 2 see what degrees u want it at hav 2 use my phone flashlight 2 mak sure where i want 2 set it , but works well sold so far gets the job done THO MY TANK IS ON 80 SO IM HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: Michael sias

customer_reviews.title: Only heaters I use
customer_reviews.text: I thought I found the perfect heater with the neotherm from cobalt, but after hearing about some catostrophic failures, I decided I couldn't risk it and swapped in these aqueon pro heaters. The competitive price point and aluminum body are the main reason I like the product; I don't have to worry about breaking it, and the inevitable failure after years in a saltwater environment doesn't set you back like a new neotherm does. I have them in 5 tanks, and although my display tank is temperature controlled with an apex, I trust the heater itself to stay in range on the other tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the temperature setting!
customer_reviews.text: I set the heater between the 84 and 80 closer to 84. I left it in the tank overnight and when i checked on it the temp was at 76. My water temperature was in the 80s when i first put it in. I'm dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: cristian

customer_reviews.title: Fishies and Froggies are Happy!
customer_reviews.text: This heater does a great job at keeping the temperature of my little 6 gallon "bookshelf" aquarium at a steady 79 degrees all the time. I wouldn't put too much trust into the numbers on the thermostat as they don't correspond with the actual temperature. But, that's not enough to be a deal breaker. Just use a thermometer, and you'll find that once you get the water at the temperature you want it at, this heater will make sure that it never budges! Also, read the directions and make sure that you let the heater "acclimate" to the water before plugging it in. A half hour to an hour should do, then you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: first time using this thermometer and its the only one ...
customer_reviews.text: first time using this thermometer and its the only one that I have that tried to cook my fish. not matter what temperature setting i tried.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Get it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: The Aqueon Pro heaters are a great product line. I have two of them now, a 100 and a 150, and they are amazing. I have absolutely no complaints and hardly ever think about them, which is how an aquarium heater should be. The temperature setting dial is easy to use, even with wet hands or at an angle, and the status light is very clear about when the heater is on. The sleek design blends in great with a black background, but I imagine it would look good anyway. Spend a little extra on these heaters and you won't regret it. I would definitely recommend these to a fellow fishkeeper.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Dial innacurate, but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: When I got it I first set the dial to 80 and my thermometer read 76, when I set it to 84 the thermometer read 80. I've left it on that setting ever since and it has stayed very steady. I have a 3 gallon tank. If you're going to get this I highly recommend you also get a thermometer so you can accurately see what the temp is inside your tank.
customer_reviews.author: adriana

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, broken within one year of use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April for a Spec V and today I woke up to an alarm on my temperature controller going off. Thank goodness for that because it turns out this heater broke and my water temperatures were in the 60s instead of the usual 80F. I can't believe how short the lifespan of this thing was! Bought a Hydor to replace the Aqueon, hopefully it will be more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: tz2z

customer_reviews.title: Easy, no fuss
customer_reviews.text: I've had this heater for several weeks, and it has worked perfectly. I have it in my 5.5 gal tank, I had to put it diagonally so I could get my lid on, but I've not had to mess with the temp settings after initially setting it. My water temperature has been consistent. I really liked the price point and the fact that it has adjustable temperature settings.
customer_reviews.author: Ema

customer_reviews.title: It broke, but customer service was great.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 1 month. Doesnt heat, doesnt light up. Update: Customer service was great and sent me another unit. Increased my rating due to quick communication and this new unit works great.
customer_reviews.author: MyPublicName

customer_reviews.title: 5 Gallon Tank in a Cold Room?
customer_reviews.text: It can get very cold in my room in the winter, so I use this heater in a 5 gallon tank (I can suffer through the cold, doesn't mean my fish should have to also). I tried a couple of other 25W heaters that were recommended for my tank size, but even on full blast they couldn't warm the water up to the temperature needed. I decided to go all out and get the 50W Aqueon, and it has worked perfectly for my set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great heater for my 20gallon
customer_reviews.text: This raised the temperature in my 20 gallon tank almost immediately. The heater that came with my tank only heats the water to 77-79 degrees. My betta was freezing! This is a great heater! And it goes up to 88 degrees!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis goslin

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for about a year, then stopped heating the tank.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfectly for about a year in my 10 gallon tank with my betta fish. After about a year of use, however, the heater no longer heats. The light that turns on when the heater is heating flashes occasionally and will not heat the tank above room temperature. Considering this heater is more expensive than the average heater, I expected it would work a lot better and last longer. If you want a heater that will last only a year, get this one. If you want something that will last longer, get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Quit after only three years, the body of the heater actually split open. Thankfully tank was not stocked at the time and I didn't lose any fish. Never had a heater perform like this. I've broken them over the years, but never had one quit and let the tank temp get dangerously low.
customer_reviews.author: Fool For Love

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 2 year
customer_reviews.text: After just over 2 years it died. The light stayed green but it would no longer heat. Almost lost my fish because of this. I trusted the light to much and assumed that the temperature was fine. I was wrong to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Great heater! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this heater for a little under a year and it's still going strong! Probably one of the best heaters I've ever worked with! the dial on top isn't quite what is pictured. the numbers on my dial are part of the same black plastic as the rest of the housing. when you set it, it is kind of hard to read, but once it's set, and you make very slight adjustments, it is solid and will stay at that temperature! the numbers at least for my 40 gallon tank are very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Llanas Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Heater
customer_reviews.text: Although it says for up to 20 Gallons, I have to crank it all the way to the max to get my 20 Gallon to barely over 80 degrees, when the dial is set to 85. It worked great when I had it in my 10 Gallon, but it is a stretch for a 20. I recommend this for people with smaller tanks, or their fish don't need warmer temperatures in a 20 Gallon.
customer_reviews.author: K. W.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s only been a few days but I prefer this way more than a heater that just comes on when it thinks the tank is too cold. My unadjustable heater was making my tank way too hot. This keeps the tank water right where I want it and not a degree higher. I like the green light that lets you know it’s monitoring the temperature and the red light shows when it’s heating
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and that's what counts.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this heater 5 star in the past. My old heaters gave up after several years of use. Which is fine. The new heaters I got from the starters disappointed me. The dial numbers are recessed on the black plastic background (please see provided photo), which makes it impossible to read. Before it was white lettering on the black background. Just like misleading photo on the packaging shows. Probably someone got the bonus for "genius" idea of cutting the cost. I'll keep it updated if something else has changed for better or for worse.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim Skarzhin

customer_reviews.title: Takes the guessing game out
customer_reviews.text: I trust this heater. You can see when it is on and when it is not via the red or green light. I love that you can set the dial to a number instead of playing a guessing game with the plus or minus system. I had a heater that malfunctioned and brought my Betta's water up to 90 degrees. Thankfully him and my snail were ok. After that I got this one and have had nothing but success with it for about a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Jax1322

customer_reviews.title: ... about purchasing after reading negative reviews but I'm really glad I bought this heater for my 29 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about purchasing after reading negative reviews but I'm really glad I bought this heater for my 29 gallon tank. It works flawlessly after 3months. I like that it's easy to see when the heater comes on and goes off. Bright led lights and fully submersible.
customer_reviews.author: Ms R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heaters
customer_reviews.text: Researched quite a bit for heaters and the Aqueon Pro heaters won as I purchased 2 (one for each 8 gallon saltwater aquarium we have). A previous brand with one temperature heated up to 95 degrees and fried my fish. I like the idea of this being fully controlled by me to my desired temperature. This small aquarium is challenging enough to control let alone have an unreliable heater. These Aqueon's have fixed the issues I have been having for quite some time with the old heaters.
customer_reviews.author: redcabo7

customer_reviews.title: Working great in turtle tank.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this in my turtle tank for about a month. Works great. I have it fully submerged horizontally. I have it set to 80 degrees. My other thermometer measures the water to usually by in the 79 degree range. Close enough for me. I especially love that it is covered in plastic & not glass. I feel very secure having it in the tank. I currently have a 20 gallon tank with maybe 12-15 gallons of water in it with a young red eared slider turtle.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mejis

customer_reviews.title: This heater week work great for that and for the next month
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my tank had ick and I needed to do a two-week heat treatment. This heater week work great for that and for the next month, but has since stopped working. It lasted maybe a month and a half. I would not recommend getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to set at temperature you want.
customer_reviews.text: There are not good instructions to set this heater. You may have to try various settings to get the temp where you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M. Loeffel

customer_reviews.title: Won’t get to temp
customer_reviews.text: Will not get to temperature in my 30 gal reef. Rear filter box but shouldn’t matter in my mind
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: Was a good heater while it worked. Unfortunately the heater absruptedly stopped working only about 2 years after I started using it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl K

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: The red indicator light (heating) vs green light (reached the desired temperature) is a nice feature. I have a 20 gallon tank - a 50 watt heater would have been adequate but I wanted to be safe in case there was an issue with my apartment heating. My main complaint is that the indicator light is slightly recessed meaning it's difficult to see at an angle (I'm paranoid and like to just swivel from my office chair to check on the heater, but now I have to get up and walk over to it).
customer_reviews.author: ferret

customer_reviews.title: it was fine for a while but....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of this months ago for two separate tanks and they were working fine, but today I noticed some red substance leaking out of it. Some of my shrimp died, and I think it was because of the substance coming out. I don't know if I happened to get 2 faulty heaters or if they are all like this, but be careful and keep a close eye on yours if you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Twice as nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heaters indeed. Submersible, shatterproof and with a very accurate sensor. I set it, dropped this 100W into a 35g (which is actually maybe a little undersized) and it's been holding a steady 78 now for a week. Bought a 2nd one to use as a backup in my 40g discus tank. A very nice feature is the green LED to let you know the tank is up to temperature. It lets you know that heater is still got power even though it isn't currently heating. Good check to make sure it hasn't gone bad.
customer_reviews.author: joemaamah

customer_reviews.title: Works great in a 20 gallon long tank
customer_reviews.text: We had a Tetra heater for years and was planning on buying another one when I read the bad reviews and decided to look into something different. So I settled on this one and I am so glad I did, it works great, looks sleek and is super easy to run.We have a stick on thermometer on the other side of the tank and adjusted the heater(which does have a temp. guide on the turn knob itself) until the right temperature was showing and have not had to touch it since. It has an indicator light to let you know if it is on and heating. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT heater
customer_reviews.text: I had previously owned a 50W heater which I had purchased without reading Amazon reviews (big mistake). It was only about $5 cheaper, but it was garbage. Long story short, I tried this guy out. For a couple more bucks and a little more space taken up in your tank (it's pretty long), you get a product that has an adjustable temperature which is maintained throughout the entire tank. No matter where I move the thermometer in the tank, it always reads an even 84. Highly recommend for anyone who has more delicate tropical species!
customer_reviews.author: Toomanycats

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but not very long-lived
customer_reviews.text: This was okay, but after a couple years of steady use it very suddenly stopped working altogether (as in, overnight), and my fishtank suddenly got too cold. It caused quite a crisis! My previous Aqueon heater lasted much longer than that, so maybe the newer models are less reliable.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my 20 Long.
customer_reviews.text: With winter coming my other heater was no longer keeping the temps up in my tank. The temp was down to 73F and I have GBR and a Bolivian Ram who prefer temps of 82F. After submerging for a half hour per instructions I turned it on and the temps were where they should be after less than an hour. I love that you can adjust the temp for higher temp fish like GBR and lower it if you had other fish that only want the normal 78F. It's been running for almost a month strait and not a single problem as of yet. Thanks Aqueon!
customer_reviews.author: AmandaB

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very particular about my aquarium heaters. I live in south Louisiana and this piece of crap couldn't keep up with a little cold snap. It lasted three months before dying and rendering my aquarium and betta cold as hell. All my other aquariums use Eheim thermometers, which I highly recommend over this Aqueon trash. They are exceptionally accurate and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to get the right adjustment to keep my 35 gallon tank around the ideal 78 temp but once I got it set it has been steadily working and keeping the temp around 78 to 79. Like the solid less breakable design compared to the glass type Aqueon heater I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: E. Linda Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost to prevent breaking
customer_reviews.text: So glad I looked at the reviews to discover these have a lifetime warranty. With receipt they will send a replacement, or send in your broken one. Wish I'd known this 10 yrs ago! I've been doing reef tanks for 40 hrs. Been thru so many brands of heaters! In my experience no brand will last any longer than another, except for the physical abuse. These won't break as easy as others. But, after owning 7 of these over the yrs expect 2-4 yrs on avg before a malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: bptexas

customer_reviews.title: My go to heater.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t typically write reviews on Amazon but I have nothing but great things to say about this heater. I have 8 of the 50 watt and one 150 watt. I have the 50 watts in 3 gallons, 5 gallons, ten gallons and 20 gallons. And the 150 watt in a 55 gallon. I’ve never had a problem with any of them and the fact that it actually has a number setting is so helpful. I’ll never buy another brand again. This heater is my holy grail.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Smith

customer_reviews.title: failed after less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: The outer casing actually split open. I did a quick internet search and this problem with Aqueon heaters apparently is not uncommon. Needless to say, not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: upptick

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Did a little research on-line and this unit seemed to be always near the top. Only had it for a short time, but the temperature is where I set it and based on the led changing from red to green seems to be cycling on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Bob N

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is keeping my betta perfectly happy in his 5 gallon tank. I test the water at least once a week and the temp doesnt budge. The temp in our house can fluctuate by 5 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Sascha Xander

customer_reviews.title: Great heater, but make sure you measure your temp as the settings are off!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice heater and it is GREAT that you can set the temp, or raise it when you need to (treating Ick) but the settings are WAY off. When I was raising the temp, it was off by anywhere between 4-6 degrees, which with fish is A LOT! so I really like it, but make sure you are testing with a digital kitchen thermometer too!
customer_reviews.author: Geoff R.Top Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Inkbird regulator, not Finnex
customer_reviews.text: Only hitch with these is that it wouldn't work with my Finnex heater control regulator, otherwise it's working fine with the Inkbird digital controller I now have. After a horrendous experience with a cheaper aquarium heater getting stuck and raising aquarium temps over 90 F, I won't run any heater without a regulator in line after it for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Little T

customer_reviews.title: Great tank heater for a 10 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: This aquarium heater does its job very well, have had it running steady for 5+ months with no issues at all. It is submerged in my 10 gallon tropical fish tank. I use it with a Willhi digital temperature controller, which I also purchased on Amazon. The Willhi gives me peace of mind that my fish will not cook if something was to happen to this heater, I would recommend purchasing both the heater and the temp controller together as a fail safe.
customer_reviews.author: Chvylove

customer_reviews.title: After Two Months, it's Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this in my aquarium for two months. In that time, it has worked great. The actual water temperature in my aquarium is spot-on with the temperature setting on the heater.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Love my heater and love this company
customer_reviews.text: Aqueon is a great company! I love all their stuff. I have had a couple water heaters for my 20 gallon that just didn't seem to cut it. I like the old style, hang on the side, kind of heater. I disliked how fragile they were though and inaccurate. This is great! It like the old ones re-imagined and better executed. I have had no issues at all and it keep my tank the temp I want. Another quality product from Aqueon!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Yoder

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised this heater can keep such a steady temperature. Easy to install, it was hard to see the red/green light from a certain angle at first. My fish have been happy since installing!
customer_reviews.author: E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Did not work, almost killed fish
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement to our Hydor heater, which lasted 3 years. We set this new one to 80 degrees, but the light was always green regardless of the temperature, which fluctuated between 76 and 79. What's worse, our fish became very sick within a day of installing the heater (fins scrunched together, lying at the bottom of the tank). After about 2 days, we removed the heater and he was back to normal within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Starbean1020

customer_reviews.title: Works but beware
customer_reviews.text: i have used this product for more than a month now and it works but from what i can understand the temperature is not always correct. i have it set at 78 but the temp of the tank is closer to 80 or 81 not a huge problem my little betta loves to play near and rest on the suction cups. It is a 5 gallon tank also for the price i paid i would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Joachim Luh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping my 5 gallon bucket from freezing
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of breaking ice out of my chicken waterer every morning, so I decided to give this a try in my 5-gallon waterer. I am so happy I did. Now, instead of breaking up ice and changing the water every morning I can wash it out every few days, because this keeps it at room temperature (I set it to 72). It's especially nice to know that if I'm out of town I don't have to worry about my water being frozen in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this heater so far. It easily blends with my black background and consistently keeps the temperature at 76 degrees in my 68 degree bedroom. I have a 20 gallon tank. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: NPUL

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: I have four of five heaters from Aqueon now. I started switching since every glass heater ends up breaking in scary and dangerous ways. This brand is actually accurate to the temperature, and that giant LED means I know whether the heater is on or not. For SW people, coraline loves this heater, so you have to scrape it off. Other than that, great heater.
customer_reviews.author: Goodbye Amazn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heater, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heater, very sturdy. I got this about a year and a half ago and it's still going strong! I have never had any issues with it, and the water always stays at the perfect temp for my tropicals. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ember's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heater
customer_reviews.text: This little 50-watt heater is awesome. I had initially purchased an Elite Submersible 50-watt since it was cheaper and had generally positive reviews, albeit a little mixed. However, the heater had stopped working properly after just a few hours. It would turn on and off at will, it seemed. I returned it and upgraded to the Aqueon Pro 50-watt and am not disappointed. Very easy to stick onto your aquarium and it's pretty accurate. In my experience so far it tends to be accurate within a +/- ~2 degree range, I have the dial set just below 84 and so far it has stayed at a steady ~81 degrees. Great overall buy!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product The only thing the suctions are constantly getting covered with some white stuff... but the heater itself is great
customer_reviews.author: Mila

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I’m very satisfied with this heater. I appreciate the exact temperatures marked on the dial, and after 3 months of use it’s kept the temp to exactly what I’ve set it to, which is pretty much all I’m looking for! Solid.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Dobbelaer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like that this heater is black because it looks better in the aquarium. I also like that it is not glass. I have a few of these that have worked flawlessly for years.
customer_reviews.author: KenD

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job of keeping my temperature consistent
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of keeping my temperature consistent. buy with confidence. I did not have to adjust the temp since it came at a great temp from factory. buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Tube Split
customer_reviews.text: Tube split 1 day after return was allowed. Not worth the money in my opinion and I have been keeping fish for over 40yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater
customer_reviews.text: Heats my entire 10 gallon tank. My fishes look happy. Also no issues with heating. Adjustable temperature makes it a must have. I would say this is the best heater for a 10 gallon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Heater
customer_reviews.text: very solid heater. The temperature scale printed on it is a degree or two off, but I wouldn't expect it to be perfect on all of them. My only real complaint is the bright blue adjustment knob, which is very unnatural looking in my planted tank.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little submersible/adjustable heater with a built-in thermostat.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year and it still works wonderfully. I got the 50 watt and it's worked in a 5.5 gallon tank, a 10, and a 29 with no issues. It does run about 2 degrees cooler but that's what a thermometer's for. They've raised in price since I bought mine though :x need a new one for a new tank but going to wait a little bit to see if the price goes back.
customer_reviews.author: SilvieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Crude & inaccurate temperature adjustment
customer_reviews.text: This was for my 5 gallon fish-tank, but first I tried it in a 5-gallon bucket for a day and a half.. The temperature reading of the knob appears to be independent of the actual temperature: adjusting it slightly one way or the other results in rapid temp swings. The system of green light/ red light / flashing light (telling you when it's at temp) does not work: it just stays on red. I was never able to attain the temperature I need (78 F). Plan to send back.
customer_reviews.author: S. O. S.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this heater
customer_reviews.text: I really like this heater, it does a great job at keeping the correct temperature that you set it at. I highly recommend in it if you're looking for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Person #1

customer_reviews.title: A quality product.
customer_reviews.text: A great product. I have nothing negative to say about it. I have multiple of the these heaters in different wattages and they are all as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Not Strong Enough
customer_reviews.text: This never worked well. I keep it at the highest setting (88 degrees) in a 10-gallon tank, and it is unable to raise the temperature higher than 72. It's certainly better than not heating the water at all, but for the price, it's disappointing that it can't reach optimal temperature for my betta.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Overall a pretty good good product
customer_reviews.text: Rugged construction. Accurate temperature control. Suction cup clamps are flimsy and could be improved some. Overall a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wishbone

product_meta.title: Aqueon Pro Submersible 50W Heater
product_meta.description: Size:100 WattThe Aqueon Pro Heaters are built with a durable, non-corrosive shell for strength and even heat distribution. They have electronic thermostats for accurate temperature settings and safety. LED power indicator light turns red when unit is heating and green when set at the selected temperature. Can be used for freshwater or saltwater fish tanks. Can be positioned horizontally or vertically (preferred method).
feature_bullets: Adjustable heat setting 68 to 88°F, Electronic Thermostat accurate to +/- 1°
Fully submersible; Auto Shut-Off when over-heats, resets when it cools down
LED light is always on: red when heating, green when not heating

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
